content.title: Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme for the Wards/Widows of Central Police Force Personnel
content.beneficiary: Wards and widows of Central Police Force personnel
content.details: The scheme was introduced by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India in the Academic year 2006-07 to encourage higher technical and professional education for the wards of widows and ex-CPFs personnel. It provides 5000 scholarships for the wards of ex-servicemen/widows of army personnel and para-military forces for pursuing advanced education in various fields.
benefits: Duration of the scholarship: Two to five years as approved by the concerned regulatory body for the programme.
eligibility: Wards and widows of CPFs personnel died in harness.
Wards of ex-CPFs personnel disabled while on duty.
Wards of ex-CPFs personnel in receipt of Gallantry Awards.
Wards & widows of Ex-CPFs/in-service personnel (Below Officer Rank i.e. up to the rank of Subedar Major /Inspector only).
content.application_process: Offline. Applications are invited from eligible candidates by 30th November of each year. Each applicant should submit their application to the concerned force Head Quarter.
documents_required: An Attested photocopy of matriculation or equivalent examination certificate for verification of date of birth.
An Attested photocopy of the mark sheet of 10 + 2/equivalent examination.
In the case of MBA/MCA applicants, an attested copy of the minimum entry qualification certificate.
Bonafide studentship certificate to be issued by Registrar/Dean/Principal of College/Institution pertaining to the particular course for which scholarship is claimed.
Attested photocopy of the previous academic year’s mark sheet for the continuation of the scholarship.
Certificate in original from College/Institution that the applicant has not dropped in any year of the course.
Certificate from College/Institute that the Institution is approved by AICTE/MCI etc.
Attested copy of discharge certificate / I-card issued by the unit commander of the concerned force as proof of ex-CPF personnel.

Copy of PPO (Special Family Pension in case of widows & Special Family Pension/Liberalized Family Pension order in case of widows of service personnel where the death of the individual is attributable to government services).
Copy of death certificate of Ex-CPFs personnel wherever applicable.
Declaration cum pre-receipt (in original) duly signed by the recipient on one rupee revenue stamp.
In the case of the ward of in-service personnel (PBOR) necessary certificate from the concerned unit commandant.
Disability certificate in case of ward of disabled personnel duly certified by the competent authority.

faqs.question: What is the aim of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of the scheme is to encourage higher technical and professional education for the wards of widows and ex-CPFs personnel.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Welfare And Rehabilitation Board, CPFs, Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The scheme was introduced in the Academic year 2006-07.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicants should be Wards/widows of CPFs personnel died in harness, Wards of ex-CPFs personnel disabled while on duty, Wards of ex-CPFs personnel in receipt of Gallantry Awards or Wards/widows of Ex-CPFs/in-service personnel (Below Officer Rank i.e. up to the rank of Subedar Major /Inspector only).

faqs.question: Which are the courses eligible for the Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The courses eligible for the Scholarship: First professional degree programme in engineering, medicine, dental, veterinary, MBA, MCA, etc. duly recognized by the respective government regulatory bodies.

faqs.question: What should be the minimum percentage of marks required at Class 12th to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: At least 60% marks at the 10+2 level required for the initial sanction.

faqs.question: What should be the minimum percentage of marks required for renewal of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: For renewal in subsequent years, 50% marks each year is mandatory.

faqs.question: Shall an applicant be eligible for a scholarship after marriage/re-marriage?
faqs.answer: Yes, a person shall be eligible for scholarship after his/her marriage/re-marriage.

faqs.question: How many children can avail of the benefits of the scheme in a family?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is admissible for two children only per family.

faqs.question: What is the amount of Scholarship given under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The amount of scholarship of ₹1250/- per month & ₹1500/- per month will be given to the boys & girls respectively.

faqs.question: What is the duration of the Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The duration of scholarship is two to five years as approved by the concerned regulatory body for the programme.

faqs.question: When will the applications be invited for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applications are invited from eligible candidates by 30th November of each year.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Each applicant should submit his/her application to the concerned force Head Quarter.
